51  public class CachingTest {
52  
53  	private ThreadPoolExecutor executor;
54  	private CacheManager ehCacheManager;
55  
56  	private MemCacheDaemon<LocalCacheElement> memcached;
57  
58  	@BeforeClass
59  	public void setup() throws Exception {
60  		this.executor = (ThreadPoolExecutor) new ExecutorServiceBuilder().setCorePoolSize(0).setMaximumPoolSize(1)
61  				.setMaximumQueueSize(0).build();
62  	}
63  
64  	@AfterClass
65  	public void destroy() throws Exception {
66  		this.executor.shutdown();
67  
68  		if (ehCacheManager != null) {
69  			ehCacheManager.shutdown();
70  		}
71  		if (memcached != null && memcached.isRunning()) {
72  			memcached.stop();
73  		}
74  	}
75  
76  	private EHRequestCache<CachedResponse> buildEhCache() {
77  		if (ehCacheManager == null) {
78  			ehCacheManager = CacheManager.create();
79  			Cache ehCache = new Cache("EHCache", 5000, false, false, 0, 0);
80  			ehCacheManager.addCache(ehCache);
81  		}
82  		EHRequestCache<CachedResponse> cache = new EHRequestCache<CachedResponse>("EHCache",
83  				ehCacheManager.getCache("EHCache"));
84  		return cache;
85  	}
86  
87  	private SpyRequestCache<CachedResponse> buildMemcache() throws IOException {
88  		if (memcached == null) {
89  			memcached = new MemCacheDaemon<LocalCacheElement>();
90  
91  			int maxItems = 5000;
92  			long maxBytes = 10 * 1024 * 1024;
93  			CacheStorage<Key, LocalCacheElement> storage = ConcurrentLinkedHashMap.create(
94  					ConcurrentLinkedHashMap.EvictionPolicy.FIFO, maxItems, maxBytes);
95  			memcached.setCache(new CacheImpl(storage));
96  			memcached.setBinary(false);
97  			memcached.setAddr(new InetSocketAddress(11211));
98  			memcached.setIdleTime(1000);
99  			memcached.setVerbose(true);
100 			memcached.start();
101 		}
102 
103 		MemcachedClient client = new MemcachedClient(AddrUtil.getAddresses("localhost:11211"));
104 		SpyRequestCache<CachedResponse> cache = new SpyRequestCache<CachedResponse>("whatever", client, 1, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
105 		return cache;
106 	}
107 
108 	private CachingSender newCachedSender(int port) {
109 		String url = "http://localhost:" + port;
110 		//HttpSender sender = new SimpleHttpSender(url);
111 		HttpSender sender = new HttpClient4Sender(url);
112 		HeapMapRequestCache<CachedResponse> cache = new HeapMapRequestCache<CachedResponse>();
113 		CachingSender csender = new CachingSender(sender, cache);
114 		csender.setExecutor(executor);
115 		return csender;
116 	}
117 
118 	@Test
119 	public void testSameRequestDifferentSender() throws IOException {
120 		JokerServer server = new JokerServer().start();
121 		HttpSender sender1 = new HttpClient4Sender("127.0.0.1:" + server.getHttpPort());
122 		HttpSender sender2 = new HttpClient4Sender("localhost:" + server.getHttpPort());
123 		//shared cache for 2 senders
124 		RequestCache<CachedResponse> cache = new HeapMapRequestCache<CachedResponse>();
125 		CachingSender csender1 = new CachingSender(sender1, cache);
126 		CachingSender csender2 = new CachingSender(sender2, cache);
127 		SenderRequest request1 = new GetRequest("/").addParameter("docache", 1);
128 		SenderRequest request2 = new GetRequest("/").addParameter("docache", 1);
129 
130 		SenderResponse response1 = csender1.execute(request1, 1, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
131 		SenderResponse response2 = csender2.execute(request2, 1, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
132 		assertThat(response2).isNotEqualTo(response1); //different sender - different host!
133 
134 		//switch Request execution to different Sender
135 		SenderResponse response3 = csender1.execute(request2, 1, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
136 		assertThat(response3).isEqualTo(response1); //same sender
137 		assertThat(response3).isNotEqualTo(response2); //different sender - different host!
138 
139 		SenderResponse response4 = csender2.execute(request1, 1, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
140 		assertThat(response4).isNotEqualTo(response1); //different sender - different host!
141 		assertThat(response4).isEqualTo(response2); //same sender
142 
143 		sender1.close();
144 		sender2.close();
145 		server.stop();
146 	}
147 
148 	@Test
149 	public void testAutomaticRefresh() throws Exception {
150 		JokerServer server = new JokerServer().start();
151 		CachingSender csender = newCachedSender(server.getHttpPort());
152 		SenderRequest request = new GetRequest("/cs").addParameter("sleep", 1);
153 		ResponseBodyExtractor<String> extractor = ResponseBodyExtractors.STRING;
154 		CachingRequest crequest = new CachingRequest(request, 4, 2, TimeUnit.SECONDS, RefreshMode.SCHEDULED); //automatic updates!
155 
156 		final int initialCount = server.getRequestCount();
157 		SenderResponse response1 = csender.execute(crequest);
158 		assertThat(server.getRequestCount()).isEqualTo(initialCount + 1);
159 		response1.close();
160 
161 		Thread.sleep(2000 + 1010); //after soft expiry + server sleep
162 		assertThat(server.getRequestCount()).isEqualTo(initialCount + 2); //background refresh
163 
164 		Thread.sleep(2000 + 1010); //after soft expiry + server sleep
165 		assertThat(server.getRequestCount()).isEqualTo(initialCount + 3); //background refresh
166 
167 		long m1 = System.currentTimeMillis();
168 		SenderResponse response2 = csender.execute(crequest);
169 		assertThat(System.currentTimeMillis() - m1).isLessThan(10);//from cache - must be quick!
170 		assertThat(response2).isNotEqualTo(response1); //different
171 		response2.close();
172 
173 		server.setHttpCode(HttpURLConnection.HTTP_INTERNAL_ERROR);
174 		Thread.sleep(5010); //after hard expiry + server sleep
175 
176 		SenderResponse response = csender.execute(crequest);
177 		assertThat(response.getHttpStatusCode() == HttpURLConnection.HTTP_INTERNAL_ERROR);
178 		assertThat(response).isNotInstanceOf(CachedResponse.class); //errors are not cached
179 		response.close();
180 
181 		csender.close();
182 		Thread.sleep(1010); //let the potential server sleep request complete
183 
184 		server.stop();
185 	}

189 		RequestCache<CachedResponse> cache;
190 		cache = new HeapMapRequestCache<CachedResponse>();
191 		doCacheTest(cache);
192 	}

198 		//cache = buildMemcache();
199 		doCacheTest(cache);
200 	}

206 		doCacheTest(cache);
207 	}

209 	@Test
210 	public void testHttpCacheControlCaching() throws Exception {
211 		JokerServer server = new JokerServer().start();
212 		CachingSender csender = newCachedSender(server.getHttpPort());
213 		//http headers will allow to cache reponse for 1 second
214 		SenderRequest request = new GetRequest("/").addParameter("docache", 1);
215 		//keep original count of request executed on server
216 		final int requestCount = server.getRequestCount();
217 
218 		//System.out.println("Doing initial request");
219 
220 		ExtractedBodyResponse<String> extract1 = csender.extract(request, ResponseBodyExtractors.STRING);
221 		assertThat(server.getRequestCount()).isEqualTo(requestCount + 1);//count + 1
222 		assertThat(extract1.getResponse().getHttpStatusCode()).isEqualTo(HttpURLConnection.HTTP_OK);
223 		assertThat(extract1.getResponse()).isInstanceOf(CachedResponse.class); //is cached
224 
225 		//System.out.println("Going to the cache");
226 
227 		ExtractedBodyResponse<String> extract2 = csender.extract(request, ResponseBodyExtractors.STRING);
228 		assertThat(server.getRequestCount()).isEqualTo(requestCount + 1); //count is same as before
229 		assertThat(extract2.getResponse().getHttpStatusCode()).isEqualTo(HttpURLConnection.HTTP_OK);
230 		assertThat(extract2.getResponse()).isInstanceOf(CachedResponse.class); //is cached
231 		assertThat(extract2.getResponse()).isSameAs(extract1.getResponse()); //1,2 are same object!
232 		assertThat(extract2.getBody()).isEqualTo(extract1.getBody()); //1,2 extracted are equal
233 
234 		Thread.sleep(1300); //let the cache entry expire
235 
236 		ExtractedBodyResponse<String> extract3 = csender.extract(request, ResponseBodyExtractors.STRING);
237 		assertThat(server.getRequestCount()).isEqualTo(requestCount + 2);//count + 2
238 		assertThat(extract3.getResponse().getHttpStatusCode()).isEqualTo(HttpURLConnection.HTTP_OK);
239 		assertThat(extract3.getResponse()).isInstanceOf(CachedResponse.class); //is cached
240 		assertThat(extract3.getResponse()).isNotSameAs(extract1.getResponse()); //not equal anymore!
241 
242 		ExtractedBodyResponse<String> extract4 = csender.extract(request, ResponseBodyExtractors.STRING);
243 		assertThat(server.getRequestCount()).isEqualTo(requestCount + 2);//count + 2
244 		assertThat(extract4.getResponse().getHttpStatusCode()).isEqualTo(HttpURLConnection.HTTP_OK);
245 		assertThat(extract4.getResponse()).isInstanceOf(CachedResponse.class); //is cached
246 		assertThat(extract4.getResponse()).isSameAs(extract3.getResponse()); //3,4 are same object!
247 		assertThat(extract4.getBody()).isEqualTo(extract3.getBody()); //3,4 extracted are equal
248 		assertThat(extract4.getBody()).isEqualTo(extract3.getBody()); //1,4 extracted are equal
249 
250 		csender.close();
251 		Thread.sleep(1010); //let the potential server sleep request complete
252 		server.stop();
253 	}
254 
255 	@Test
256 	public void testHttpETagCaching() throws Exception {
257 		JokerServer server = new JokerServer().start();
258 		CachingSender csender = newCachedSender(server.getHttpPort());
259 
260 		//keep original count of request executed on server
261 		final int requestCount = server.getRequestCount();
262 
263 		//http headers will use ETag
264 		SenderRequest request1 = new GetRequest("/").addParameter("doetag");
265 		ExtractedBodyResponse<String> extract1 = csender.extract(request1, ResponseBodyExtractors.STRING);
266 		assertThat(server.getRequestCount()).isEqualTo(requestCount + 1);//count + 1
267 		assertThat(extract1.getResponse().getHttpStatusCode()).isEqualTo(HttpURLConnection.HTTP_OK);
268 		assertThat(extract1.getResponse()).isInstanceOf(CachedResponse.class); //is cached
269 		//System.out.println(extract1.getExtracted());
270 		//System.out.println(extract1.getResponse());
271 
272 		Thread.sleep(100); //
273 
274 		SenderRequest request2 = new GetRequest("/").addParameter("doetag");
275 		ExtractedBodyResponse<String> extract2 = csender.extract(request2, ResponseBodyExtractors.STRING);
276 		assertThat(server.getRequestCount()).isEqualTo(requestCount + 2);//count + 2 (304 NOT_MODIFIED)
277 		assertThat(extract2.getResponse().getHttpStatusCode()).isEqualTo(HttpURLConnection.HTTP_OK);
278 		assertThat(extract2.getResponse()).isInstanceOf(CachedResponse.class); //is cached
279 		//System.out.println(extract2.getExtracted());
280 		//System.out.println(extract2.getResponse());
281 		//assertThat(extract2.getResponse()).isSameAs(extract1.getResponse()); //1,2 are same object!
282 		assertThat(extract2.getBody()).isEqualTo(extract1.getBody()); //1,2 extracted are equal
283 
284 		csender.close();
285 		Thread.sleep(1010); //let the potential server sleep request complete
286 		server.stop();
287 	}
288 
289 	/**
290 	 * Basic caching operations we expect to work with any cache implementation
291 	 */
292 	private void doCacheTest(RequestCache<CachedResponse> cache) throws InterruptedException, IOException {
293 
294 		CachedResponse cresponse = new CachedResponse(200, "Choroso", new Multival(), new Date().toString());
295 		String cacheKey = String.valueOf(System.currentTimeMillis());
296 		//hard ttl is 2 seconds
297 		Boolean added = cache.set(cacheKey, new CacheEntry<CachedResponse>(cresponse, 2, 1));
298 		assertThat(added).isTrue();
299 
300 		CacheEntry<CachedResponse> entry = cache.get(cacheKey);
301 		assertThat(entry.getValue().getAsString()).isEqualTo(cresponse.getAsString());
302 		assertThat(entry.isSoftExpired()).isFalse();
303 		assertThat(entry.isHardExpired()).isFalse();
304 
305 		Thread.sleep(1010); //after soft ttl
306 
307 		entry = cache.get(cacheKey);
308 		assertThat(entry.getValue().getAsString()).isEqualTo(cresponse.getAsString());
309 		assertThat(entry.isSoftExpired()).isTrue();
310 		assertThat(entry.isHardExpired()).isFalse();
311 
312 		Thread.sleep(2010); //after hard ttl + 1 second (memcached has this whole second precision)
313 
314 		entry = cache.get(cacheKey);
315 		assertThat(entry).isNull();
316 	}

318 	//@Test
319 	public void testFacebook() throws IOException {
320 		//https://developers.facebook.com/tools/explorer
321 		//Facebook uses ETag
322 		//ETag: "9ea8f5a5b1d659bc8358daad6f2e347f15f6e683"
323 		//Expires: Sat, 01 Jan 2000 00:00:00 GMT
324 		HttpSender sender = new HttpClient4Sender("https://graph.facebook.com");
325 		HeapMapRequestCache<CachedResponse> cache = new HeapMapRequestCache<CachedResponse>();
326 		CachingSender csender = new CachingSender(sender, cache);
327 
328 		GetRequest request = new GetRequest("/me/friends");
329 		request
330 				.addParameter(
331 						"access_token",
332 						"AAAAAAITEghMBAOK0zAh6obLGcPm5FuXt3OlqMWPmgudEF9KxrVBiNt6AjccUFCSoZAxRr8ZBvGZBi9sOdZBxebQZBJzVMwRKzIWCLZCjzxGV0cvAMkDjXu");
333 		//request.addParameter("fields", "id,name");
334 		ExtractedBodyResponse<String> response = csender.extract(request, ResponseBodyExtractors.STRING);
335 		assertThat(response.getResponse()).isInstanceOf(CachedResponse.class);
336 
337 		ExtractedBodyResponse<String> response2 = csender.extract(request, ResponseBodyExtractors.STRING);
338 		assertThat(response2.getResponse()).isInstanceOf(CachedResponse.class);
339 		assertThat(response2.getResponse()).isEqualTo(response.getResponse());
340 		System.out.println(response.getBody());
341 	}

343 	//https://code.google.com/apis/console
344 	//@Test
345 	public void testGoogleApi() throws Exception {
346 
347 		//https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/staticmaps/
348 		//Google maps uses Expires
349 		//Cache-Control: public, max-age=86400
350 		//Date: Tue, 26 Feb 2013 16:11:16 GMT
351 		//Expires: Wed, 27 Feb 2013 16:11:16 GMT
352 		HttpSender sender = new HttpClient4Sender("http://maps.googleapis.com/maps/api/staticmap");
353 		HeapMapRequestCache<CachedResponse> cache = new HeapMapRequestCache<CachedResponse>();
354 		CachingSender csender = new CachingSender(sender, cache);
355 		GetRequest request = new GetRequest("/");
356 		request.addParameter("key", "AIzaSyCgNUVqbYTyIP_f4Ew2wJXSZ9XjIQ8F5w8");
357 		request.addParameter("center", "51.477222,0");
358 		request.addParameter("size", "10x10");
359 		request.addParameter("sensor", false);
360 		ExtractedBodyResponse<String> extract = sender.extract(request, String.class);
361 		System.out.println(extract.getBody());
362 		sender.close();
363 
364 		if (true)
365 			return;
366 
367 		KeyStore keyStore = KeyStore.getInstance("PKCS12");
368 		keyStore.load(new FileInputStream("/Users/martin.vanek/Downloads/google_privatekey.p12"),
369 				"notasecret".toCharArray());
370 		PrivateKey privateKey = (PrivateKey) keyStore.getKey("privatekey", "notasecret".toCharArray());
371 		String header = Base64.encodeBase64String("{\"alg\":\"RS256\",\"typ\":\"JWT\"}".getBytes());
372 		System.out.println(header);
373 		long iat = System.currentTimeMillis() / 1000;
374 		long exp = iat + 60 * 60;
375 		String data = "{" //
376 				+ "\"iss\":\"164620382615@developer.gserviceaccount.com\","//
377 				+ "\"scope\":\"https://www.googleapis.com/auth/prediction\","//
378 				+ "\"aud\":\"https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/token\"," //
379 				+ "\"exp\":" + exp + "," + "\"iat\":" + iat//
380 				+ "}";
381 		String claimset = Base64.encodeBase64String(data.getBytes());
382 		String content = header + "." + claimset;
383 
384 		Signature signature = Signature.getInstance("SHA256withRSA");
385 		signature.initSign(privateKey);
386 		signature.update(content.getBytes());
387 		byte[] sign = signature.sign();
388 		String digsig = Base64.encodeBase64String(sign);
389 		String assertion = content + "." + digsig;
390 		System.out.println(assertion);
391 		sender = new HttpClient4Sender("https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/token");
392 		PostRequest request2 = sender.POST("").build();
393 		request2.addParameter("grant_type", "urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer");
394 		request2.addParameter("assertion", assertion);
395 		ExtractedBodyResponse<String> x = sender.extract(request2, String.class);
396 		System.out.println(x.getBody());
397 	}
398 
399 	//@Test
400 	public void testGoogle() throws IOException {
401 		//google protect itself from being cached
402 		//Expires: -1
403 		//Cache-Control: private, max-age=0
404 		HttpSender sender = new HttpClient4Sender("http://www.google.co.uk");
405 		HeapMapRequestCache<CachedResponse> cache = new HeapMapRequestCache<CachedResponse>();
406 		CachingSender csender = new CachingSender(sender, cache);
407 
408 		SenderResponse response = csender.execute(new GetRequest("/"));
409 		assertThat(response.getHttpStatusCode()).isEqualTo(HttpURLConnection.HTTP_OK);
410 		assertThat(response).isNotInstanceOf(CachedResponse.class); //not cached!
411 		response.close();
412 
413 		//enforce static caching
414 		SenderResponse response2 = csender.execute(new GetRequest("/"), 5, TimeUnit.MINUTES);
415 		assertThat(response2.getHttpStatusCode()).isEqualTo(HttpURLConnection.HTTP_OK);
416 		assertThat(response2).isInstanceOf(CachedResponse.class);
417 		response2.close();
418 
419 		SenderResponse response3 = csender.execute(new GetRequest("/"), 5, TimeUnit.MINUTES);
420 		assertThat(response3).isEqualTo(response2); //must be same instance 
421 		response3.close();
422 	}
